sentence.Network_en: It is an unpalatable fact that rape makes a good news story.
sentence.Network_cn: 强奸事件成了新闻报道的好素材，真是令人难以接受。

sentence.Network_en: Only then did I learn the unpalatable truth.
sentence.Network_cn: 直到那时我才得知令人难以接受的真相。

sentence.Network_en: It was only then that I began to learn the unpalatable truth about John.
sentence.Network_cn: 直到那时我才开始了解到有关约翰的一些令人难以接受的实情。

entry.tran: （意见等）令人不快的，难以接受的
entry.def: If you describe an idea as unpalatable, you mean that you find it unpleasant and difficult to accept.

example.ex: It is an unpalatable fact that rape makes a good news story...
example.tran: 强奸事件成了新闻报道的好素材，真是令人难以接受。

example.ex: It was only then that I began to learn the unpalatable truth about John.
example.tran: 直到那时我才开始了解到有关约翰的一些令人难以接受的实情。

entry.def: If you describe food as unpalatable, you mean that it is so unpleasant that you can hardly eat it.

example.tran: 一块干巴巴、难以入口的奶酪

means.word_mean: 1. not pleasant or acceptable to the taste or mind;
